dlgPart.npc_text:
You’re standing in a large underground chamber, crowded with a host of bizarre machines and contraptions. The air reeks of old lubricant, rust, and harder to place scents. After trying to figure out the purpose of the equipment and the chamber itself, you decide the machinery must have been brought here from elsewhere for storage or display. The place is like a shrine to an age long past.
Drawn to a low flickering to your left, you approach what you took to be a still functional device, but the apparatus is long dead. The light comes from several small candles housed in a row of glass tubes painted red.
“Who are you?” says the elder, his face hidden by the cloak.
“Many have come before you. Few had the wisdom to leave.”

“A woman,” nods the Elder. “I was but a child when she came here, but I still remember her. She demanded an escort. The Elder refused and she killed him on the spot, without pity or mercy.
“She took our best men who were more afraid of her than of the beasts crawling in the hollow and left. She returned alone, but she never said a word and we never asked for it’s not our way.”

The Elder laughs. “She’s drained our strength and we’ve never recovered. There are no men left to give you. We buy children,” he points at the young man who greeted you, “to replace lost brothers and keep the flame alive.”
“These holy engines were entrusted in our care,” he points at the machines. Most of them seem to be long dead. “It is our duty to maintain them.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Do you know what these machines did?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “We pray and ask the Gods to guide our hands.”
“The Gods aren’t always there to answer our call, so few engines are still working. Of course, when the Gods need them, we’ll be ready and they’ll guide us like they always have.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Do you know what these machines did?”

dlgPart.npc_text:
“Wondrous things!” exclaims the elder, showing his face for a moment. It looks strangely deformed: large, unblinking, “fish” eyes, wide, lipless mouth, and thick skin hanging in folds.
“They could raise the water in the river to the level of the lake. They could turn night into day and day into night. They could even conjure a bridge made of light over the lake.”

dlgAnsw.text: “Do you mind if I take a closer look at the machines?”

dlgPart.npc_text: “You want to marvel at the holy relics?” the elder says approvingly. “You may do so. Perhaps, you’d like to stay with us and dedicate your life to worship. I’ll pray for the divine to touch you and mark you as it marked me.” He touches his face reverently.
“Would you like to pray with me?”
“It’s a miracle! The Gods restored the bridge, working their will through you, <brother/sister>! Soon the Great Ziggurat’s door will be opened and we’ll bask in the Gods’ glory!”
